newsitem.title: GERMANY: Deutsche-MAGM managers operated in "grey area".
newsitem.headline: Deutsche-MAGM managers operated in "grey area".

text.p: Peter Young and Stewart Armer, the fund managers suspended this week from Deutsche Bank AG's MAGM unit in London, were operating in a "grey area" with regard to regulations, Deutsche Bank said on Thursday.
"Neither manager committed an obvious breach of regulations. But both were hovering on the brink of a grey area," said Deutsche spokesman Detlev Rahmsdorf in response to a Reuter query.

The fund managers were suspended pending an investigation into alleged irregularities in three Morgan Grenfell Asset Management (MGAM) funds, which were suspended from trade Monday but resumed trading Thursday.
MAGM has filed an injunction to freeze Peter Young's assets. It suspended Armer on Wednesday evening, citing a suspected breach of personal account dealing rules.
Rahmsdorf also said the 180 million pounds Deutsche had paid for securities of the funds marked the end of its investment in the affair.
The amount of the investment had been agreed with all supervisory authorities involved, in the U.K. and in Ireland, he said.
